name: DJ Marfox
description:
'''DJ Marfox''' (born '''Marlon Silva''' in June 1988) is a Portuguese [[DJ]] best known for pioneering {{lang|pt|batida}} or {{lang|pt|batucada}}, a music genre that emerged from [[Lisbon|Lisbon's]] housing estates. Batida and Batucada are referred to as the "ghetto sound of Lisbon", and they incorporate African-influenced dance music such as [[kuduro]], [[kizomba]], [[funan√°]] and tarraxinha with [[house music|house]] and [[techno]].

Taking inspiration from a Nintendo character, 'Marfox' merged part of his first name "Marl" from "Marlon" with [[Star Fox 64|Star Fox]], a character he played as a teenager.
